page.title: 03CHANGE IN RHU AND DISTRICT.
page.content: On interviewing many of the local residents we discovered that most agreed that the greatest change to have taken place in Rhu over the years was the vast increase in population brought about mainly by the development of the nearby Faslane Naval Base and of course, the inevitable increase in housing to accommodate employees. This has also resulted in the increased volume of traffic on the roads and where previously, a narrow country road wound round the shores of the Gareloch now a modern two lane,in one area three lane highway cuts through former gardens of lochside mansion houses.The Clynder side of the loch has experienced similiar changes but to a far lesser extent-an increase in population but only some upgrading of roads at present.
